question: [File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Function: create_commit_callback()] [Panic in callback] If handle_committed_blocks() panics, does the callback propagate panic to caller, potentially crashing the execution pipeline? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Function: create_commit_callback_deprecated()] [API deprecation race] Can mixing deprecated and new callback APIs cause inconsistent state updates where some commits use old logic and others new logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Function: create_commit_callback_deprecated()] [WrappedLedgerInfo ignored] Does the deprecated callback ignore the first parameter (WrappedLedgerInfo), and can this lead to missing important metadata in commit processing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Struct: ObserverBlockData] [Store synchronization] Can block_payload_store, ordered_block_store, and pending_block_store become desynchronized if one update fails while others succeed, creating inconsistent view of blocks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Struct: ObserverBlockData] [Root inconsistency] Can self.root become inconsistent with actual highest committed block in ordered_block_store, causing get_highest_committed_epoch_round() to return wrong values? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Struct: ObserverBlockData] [Memory exhaustion] Are there any bounds on the total memory consumed by all three stores combined, or can they grow unbounded causing OOM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Struct: ObserverBlockData] [Lock-free access] Does any code access the stores without proper locking when ObserverBlockData is wrapped in Arc<Mutex>, causing data races? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: insert_block_payload + verify_payloads_against_ordered_block] [Verification bypass] Can an attacker insert unverified payloads, then call verify_payloads_against_ordered_block with a crafted OrderedBlock that makes verification succeed for invalid payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: insert_ordered_block + get_parent_pipeline_futs] [Parent mismatch] Can inserting blocks with invalid parent QCs cause get_parent_pipeline_futs to return futures from wrong parent, leading to invalid state transitions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: insert_pending_block + remove_ready_pending_block] [Payload injection attack] Can an attacker insert pending block, then insert malicious payload and immediately call remove_ready_pending_block to bypass proper ordering checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: handle_committed_blocks + update_blocks_for_state_sync_commit] [Double commit removal] Can both functions execute concurrently for same block, causing remove_blocks_for_epoch_round to be called twice, potentially removing future blocks incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: clear_block_data + insert operations] [Clear race] Can clear_block_data() be called while inserts are happening, causing some blocks to be inserted into empty stores while others are cleared, leaving partial state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: update_root + get_last_ordered_block] [Epoch boundary race] Can update_root advance to new epoch while get_last_ordered_block returns block from old epoch, causing invalid parent relationships across epoch boundary? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Cross-function: verify_payload_signatures + insert_block_payload] [Signature status race] Can payloads be inserted with verified=false, verification initiated, but then overwritten with verified=true before signature check completes, accepting unverified payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: empty stores] [Division by zero] Do any metric calculations or store operations assume non-empty stores, potentially causing panics when all stores are empty? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: epoch boundary] [Epoch transition] At epoch boundaries, can blocks from new epoch be inserted before old epoch blocks are cleared, causing mixed-epoch state in stores? (High)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: round overflow] [Integer overflow] Can round numbers overflow u64 over long chain history, causing wraparound that breaks ordering in BTreeMap stores? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: Genesis block] [Genesis handling] Does handling of genesis blocks (round 0, epoch 0) work correctly in all functions, or can genesis edge cases cause unexpected behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: Nil blocks] [Empty block handling] If ordered blocks contain empty block lists, can this cause panics in functions that assume at least one block exists? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/consensus/src/consensus_observer/observer/block_data.rs] [Edge case: Duplicate epoch/round] [Key collision] Can multiple blocks with same (epoch, round) key collide in BTreeMap stores, with later insertions overwriting earlier valid blocks? (High)
